üì¢ We have reduced the initial margin requirement for short dated (D1 and D2) BTC options to 2%, i.e. max allowed leverage is now 50x 20th June, 7:10 PM UTC

üì¢ In light of unprecedented market volatility, we have temporarily increased the initial margin requirements for short options trades. The new initial margin requirements are as follows:

BTC: 5% (max leverage 20x)
ETH : 10% (max leverage 10x)
All other underlyings: 50% (max leverage: 2x)

This is a temporary change, implemented as a prudent risk management practice. Once markets stabilize, we will look to revert to higher leverages. 19th June, 5:30 PM UTC

Try here for free üëâ Try Now 5th May, 12:30 PM UTC

Sub Accounts are launched : Now trade on Delta Exchange through multiple sub accounts.
Sub-accounts are separate from your Main account. Each sub-account on Delta Exchange has independent balances, margin and positions and can trade independently. This make sub-accounts helpful in isolating positions, margin or access. Sub-accounts can be used by a single trader to run multiple strategies independently or by a firm with multiple traders, with each trader having its own sub-account.
To know more Click Here 5th May, 12:30 PM UTC

Portfolio margin launched for BTC and ETH (USDT settled contracts only). This risk based margining method offsets the margin requirements of opposing positions resulting in higher capital efficiency. Enable through preferences menu or margin selection pane to try portfolio margin.

Ethereum London Hard Fork

The Ethereum blockchain is scheduled to undergo London Upgrade at 5th August 2021 12:32pm UTC. The upgrade will result in a hard fork and hence there's a possibility of two temporarily two chains being created. To manage the risks around this event, We will be suspending deposits and withdrawals for ETH and ERC-20 tokens till the time situation stablises. However, there will be no impact on trading.
